page.title: 13Employment in Chelmsley Wood
page.content: The Careers Office was opened in 1977 and is staffed by Careers Officers with their support staff. They deal mainly with school leavers but older people also seek assistance. Numbers dealt with range from 50(after christmas) to 265(beginning of June when school leavers apply). Careers Officers claim a placement rate of 65-70%, mainly in clerical, retail or construction work. In addition the Job Centre, opened in 1976, deals with about 1,000 enquiries per week. Many more peruse the notice boards. Jobs on offer average 35 weekly in the neighbourhood and 150 shared with other Centres. Local employment is found in hospitals, hotels, airport and N.E.C.
